direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods modify the count of elements in the multiset but in opposite directions (addition vs. removal).
Both methods involve validating the object and then modifying the count of elements in the multiset, sharing similar control flows and exception handling.
The 'add' method directly depends on the 'validate' method for object validation before modifying the multiset.
The 'add' method relies on the 'decorated' method to access the underlying multiset for performing the actual addition operation.
Both methods interact with the multiset to retrieve or modify the count of elements, though they serve different purposes.
